CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 5, 1961, pg. 16 reads: "Zionites Cited For Service - One of the special features of the Japanese Garden Party, sponsored recently by the AME Zion Pittsburgh District, on the Wesley Center lawn, was the awards ceremony, conducted by Bishop S.G. Spottswood, second from right, who presented certificates of appreciation, on behalf of the district, to the Rev. C.H .Foggie, pastor of Wesley Center, and conference laymen, for long tenures of service in various official capacities. Standing, left to right, are E.G. Webster Sr., 40 years church school treasurer at Wesley Center; Mrs. Carrie Fuqua, 41 years for 30 years a trustee at Wesley Center; Mrs. Harriet Coleman, 37 years a district officer; the Rev. Mr. Foggie, 17 years a pastor and civic leader in Pittsburgh; Bishop Spottswood, making the awards, and I. Newton Pryor, 43 years as organist and choirmaster at the West End AME Zion Church.- Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Wesley Center AMEZ service citation honorees, from left: E. G. Webster Sr., Carrie Fuqua, unknown man, Harriet Coleman, Rev. Charles Foggie, Bishop S. G. Spottswood, making presentations; and I. Newton Pryor, gathered on Wesley Center AME Zion Church lawn during garden party
